title: Can God give us the desires of our hearts even if it is an impossible proposal or wish? - Quora

response.answer_text: Hi (Luke 18:27 & Hebrews 11:1 & 6) hope this can help U a little, much love many blessings Gbu L Peter Hebrews 11:1 & 6 - 1 Now faith is the substance of things hoped for, the evidence of things not seen. 6 But without faith it is impossible to please him: for he that cometh to God must believe that he is, and that he is a rewarder of them that diligently seek him. Luke 18:27 And he said, The things which are impossible with men are possible with God.

God gave us all a entire planet with all the resources we need. What else do you think you deserve? God gave us free will, not just you, but everyone, so bad stuff and good stuff is going to happen. God is not a politician that will give you whatever you want if your say the right things. Start a relationship with God without expecting anything and you may find the impossible is done, but it will be on his terms not yours.

That is a fascinating question. Since it is real a religious question I removed the heart (organ) tag that was associated with it. We are humans and thusblikited by what we can imagine or desire. So if one believes in an all powerful divine creator. Yes they can of course do so, because nothing that we can imagine or even desire is beyond the capability of that divine creator.

Psalm 37:4 says, “Delight yourself in the LORD and Hevwull give you the desires of your heart.” And we also know, from the teaching of Jesus, “With God, nothing is impossible.” And “Faith is the substance of things not seen.” So although we can’t really know how God can do “impossible” things, we know He is able.

Absolutely!, BUT he also knows our desires may not be the best for us, so he says no. It’s like a little kids asking for candy all the time, as a parent you say no and only from time to time you give candy. Same concept, and yes, most times God says no.

The old “Can God make a mountain that too high for him to climb” question. It is internally contradictory. You have to temper the conflicting terms or is it just a waste of time. Do you want to play a silly game or learn about prayer?

well it can be possible all what you must do is work hard for what you want and believe in him and in yourself to achieving it …… maby it wil not happened in a month or a year but some day you will get what you've wished for It will be tough and hard work but it will all be worth it
I don’t believe in God and my heart only pumps blood. So, the answers an unequivocal, “No.”
Um … the Creator of the universe doesn’t see anything as impossible. He hung the stars in space … remember?
God knows what is best for us. He always wants to give to his children. But never anything that would in the long run bring harm to us.
